body: @meteorcloudy Looks like the compatibility trick doesn't work. We could require the latest patch version of the JDK or always ignore unknown VM options on Windows, not sure what's better.

body:
> We could require the latest patch version of the JDK or always ignore unknown VM options on Windows

Requiring latest patch version of the JDK will break users running bazel_nojdk? I'm fine with always ignore unknown VM options on Windows

issue.title: Restore compatibility with any JDK 23 on Windows

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
`-XX:-IgnoreUnrecognizedVMOptions` is always evaluated at the beginning of argument parsing and thus can't be used to disable the feature before consuming `--host_jvm_args`.

Fixes #25312

issue.title: [8.1.1] Restore compatibility with any JDK 23 on Windows
